alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Escambia Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 1:11AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mobile, Baldwin, southern Washington, west central Santa Rosa, Escambia, George, Perry, Greene and Stone Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1211 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Macedonia to 5 miles southwest of Beaumont to 7 miles north of Lucedale to 5 miles east of Citronelle to 11 miles east of Stapleton to 3 miles west of Point Baker. Movement was southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Daphne, Tillmans Corner, Warrington, Fairhope, Saraland, Gonzalez, Bay Minette, Foley, Pace, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Orange Beach, Wiggins and Robertsdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Escambia Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland
